result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christian D Hill in court, in custody. Attorney Jason Daane for Obi Uzowulu in court for Christian D Hill. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Upon motion of the State case is  granted to be dismissed and read-in. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed.  Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

3:01pm Court in session

Defendant Christian Hill present in court, in custody via video with attorney Obi Uzowulu. J.J. Crawford appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Uzowulu asks that he have a moment to discuss Deft's options. Court will clear the courtroom for Atty Uzowulu to speak to Deft. 

3:10pm Case re-called
Appearance remain. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Courtesy copy of criminal information provided to the Court

Parties are asking for plea & sentencing on the call

3:12pm Court in recess
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christian D Hill in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Leah Selmek for Obi Uzowulu in court for Christian D Hill. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and hearing requested within time period. Attorney Uzowulu needs time to review discovery, asking for 30 days. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CF174, 20CF492 & 20CF262

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH QUALITY INN. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christian D Hill in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant does qualify for SPD. Defendant was extradited.  New total bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
